declarations.comments:
Simple console demo of Fibonacci calculation using worker pool

This demonstrates:
- Creating a worker pool
- Distributing work across multiple threads
- Collecting results
- Proper cleanup
declarations.title: FibInput

declarations.comments:
Console demo of SharedInt (atomic counter) across worker threads

This demonstrates:
- Creating a shared atomic counter
- Passing shared memory to workers via workerData
- Concurrent increments from multiple workers
- Reading the final value
declarations.title: CounterInput

declarations.comments:
Console demo of SharedMap (concurrent hash map with striped locks)

This demonstrates:
- Creating a shared concurrent hash map
- Insert, lookup, and modify operations
- Thread-safe concurrent access
- Striped lock-based synchronization
declarations.title: mapDemo

declarations.comments:
Console demo of SharedState (JSON-serialized shared state with spinlock)

This demonstrates:
- Creating shared state with JSON serialization
- Reading and writing shared state
- Atomic modify operations
- Spinlock-based synchronization
declarations.title: stateDemo

declarations.title: FibInput

declarations.comments: Output type for the worker
declarations.title: FibOutput

declarations.comments: CPU-intensive Fibonacci calculation (intentionally inefficient for demo)

Worker main function

Entry point for the worker
This must be the main function when bundled

Worker main function
This receives inputs and sends back outputs

declarations.comments: Entry point for the worker
declarations.title: main

declarations.comments: Worker pool handle
declarations.title: WorkerPool

declarations.comments: Configuration for a worker pool
declarations.title: PoolConfig

declarations.comments: Default pool configuration (4 workers)
declarations.title: defaultPoolConfig

declarations.comments: Create a worker pool. Must be paired with `terminatePool`.
declarations.title: makePool

declarations.comments: Create a worker pool with shared data accessible to all workers via `workerData`.
declarations.title: makePoolWithData

declarations.comments: Terminate a worker pool and all its threads.
declarations.title: terminatePool

declarations.comments:
Distribute work across the worker pool in parallel.
Each input is submitted to the pool and processed by the next available worker.
declarations.title: distributeWork

contents.contents: is not known to be Sendable

declarations.comments:
Only Sendable things can be sent back and forth between a worker thread and
its parent. These include things that are represented by JavaScript primitives.
Arbitrary PureScript values cannot be sent, but variants, records and newtypes
of these things can. If you have a newtype of some Sendable, you must wrap it.
declarations.title: Sendable

declarations.comments:
An atomic integer reference backed by SharedArrayBuffer.
Can be shared across worker threads via `toSendable`/`fromSendable`.
declarations.title: SharedInt

declarations.comments:
A shared concurrent map backed by SharedArrayBuffer with striped locks.
Keys are Strings, values must be JSON-serializable.
The keyspace is split into N segments for N-way concurrency.
declarations.title: SharedMap

declarations.comments:
Buffer layout:
- Int32 slot 0 (bytes 0..3): mutex lock (0 = unlocked, 1 = locked)
- Int32 slot 1 (bytes 4..7): data length in bytes
- Bytes 8..N: UTF-8 encoded JSON string
A shared mutable state that can be accessed from multiple worker threads.
Values are JSON-serialized into a SharedArrayBuffer with a spinlock mutex.
declarations.title: SharedState

declarations.comments:
An atomic integer reference backed by SharedArrayBuffer.
Can be shared across worker threads via `toSendable`/`fromSendable`.
declarations.title: SharedInt

declarations.comments: Create a new SharedInt initialized to the given value.
declarations.title: new

declarations.comments: Atomically read the current value.
declarations.title: read

declarations.comments: Atomically write a new value.
declarations.title: write

declarations.comments: Atomically add to the current value. Returns the OLD value.
declarations.title: add

declarations.comments: Atomically subtract from the current value. Returns the OLD value.
declarations.title: sub

declarations.comments:
Atomic compare-and-swap. If current value equals `expected`,
replace with `replacement`. Returns the old value.
declarations.title: compareAndSwap

declarations.comments:
Atomically modify the value using a CAS loop.
Retries until the CAS succeeds.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Wrap for sending to a worker thread.
declarations.title: toSendable

declarations.comments: Unwrap after receiving on a worker thread.
declarations.title: fromSendable

declarations.comments:
A shared concurrent map backed by SharedArrayBuffer with striped locks.
Keys are Strings, values must be JSON-serializable.
The keyspace is split into N segments for N-way concurrency.
declarations.title: SharedMap

declarations.comments:
Create a new empty SharedMap.
`numSegments` controls concurrency (e.g., 16 or 64).
`maxBytesPerSegment` is the max JSON size per segment.
declarations.title: new

declarations.comments: Look up a key. Returns Nothing if not found.
declarations.title: lookup

declarations.comments: Insert or overwrite a key-value pair.
declarations.title: insert

declarations.comments: Delete a key. No-op if key doesn't exist.
declarations.title: delete

declarations.comments: Atomically modify the value at a key. Returns the new value, or Nothing if not found.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Wrap for worker transfer.
declarations.title: toSendable

declarations.comments: Unwrap on the worker side. Reconstructs Int32Array views from the shared buffer.
declarations.title: fromSendable

declarations.comments:
Buffer layout:
- Int32 slot 0 (bytes 0..3): mutex lock (0 = unlocked, 1 = locked)
- Int32 slot 1 (bytes 4..7): data length in bytes
- Bytes 8..N: UTF-8 encoded JSON string
A shared mutable state that can be accessed from multiple worker threads.
Values are JSON-serialized into a SharedArrayBuffer with a spinlock mutex.
declarations.title: SharedState

declarations.comments:
Create a new SharedState with an initial value.
`maxBytes` is the maximum size for the serialized JSON data.
declarations.title: new

declarations.comments: Atomically read the current state.
declarations.title: read

declarations.comments: Atomically write a new state value.
declarations.title: write

declarations.comments: Atomically modify the state. Returns the new value.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Wrap for worker transfer. The underlying SharedArrayBuffer is shared.
declarations.title: toSendable

declarations.comments: Unwrap on the worker side. Reconstructs Int32Array views from the shared buffer.
declarations.title: fromSendable
